issue.title: create align module
issue.body:
#### Reference Issues/PRs
- Fixes #367 (except modified Procrustes).
- Fixes #429 
- Also see #380 

#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.
- Introduces align module, which has the following three classes:
  - SignFlips
    - Previously a function in the LatentDistributionTest.
  - OrthogonalProcrustes
    - Effectively a wrapper of the scipy.linal.orthogonal_procrustes().
  - SeedlessProcrustes
    - Also colloquially known as JAgt; aligns the two dataset via an iterative algorithm that alternates optimal transport and regular procrustes.
    - Massively sped up from the previous implementation, predominantly by omitting the outer-most loop, and also by using the POT package.
- All classes have a consistent .fit_transform() type of API, where they take two datasets in fit() and one dataset in transform.
- Substitutes scipy.linal.orthogonal_procrustes() and LatentDistributionTest.medial_sign_flips() with objects of the module everywhere where applicable.
- Added an option to use SeedlessProcrustes as alignment techniques in LatentDistributionTest (but not default yet); added necessary arguments and documentation.
- Includes tests for all of the modules, as well as tests for the new / changed functionality of the tests.
- Some comments / docs changed / added in LPT / LDT.
- fit_plug_in_variance_estimator migrated from LatentDistributionTest to utils. Unchanged otherwise (future work will be #378).
- fixed the docs of the inference module while i was at it.
- Slightly refactored LDT code (see #380). .metric is now always what user is provided. The associated callable is .metric_func(). Furthermore, .test is now what user has provided as test. hyppo object get instantiated in .fit, which should be much safer for resuing. 

#### Any other comments?
- No tutorial notebooks made. See #414 .
- Does NOT implement scaling-rotation or diagonal-rotation type of procrustes as a part of the module.

body: @bdpedigo I'd be up for writing tutorials for this for Sprint 1 as well. I'm interested in writing these tutorials or tutorials for the clustering algorithms.
I'm interested in this issue too. I think maybe writing the tutorials will be a more applicable task for me, since I'm just starting to learn the graph theory. Not sure, need more advice.

issue.title: Tutorials: Meta-Issue
issue.body:
If nobody minds, I decided to make a list of all tutorial that exist and don't yet, and mark which need to be updated/created. I was a little confused by the multitude of issues, and I have a feeling that I am not the only one. @bdpedigo , please feel free to edit this post as you like.

- Models
  - Random Graph Models
  - (Eventually merge with simulations.)
    - [ ] Needs to be modified; see #368 for more information on merging models and simulations.
- Simulations
  - Erdos-Renyi (ER) Model
  - Stochastic Block Model (SBM)
  - Random Dot Product Graph (RDPG) Model
  - Correlated Graph Pairs
  - Correlated Random Dot Product Graph (RDPG) Graph Pair
- Embedding
  - Adjacency Spectral Embed
  - Embedding Multiple Graphs (aka OMNI?)
  - MASE
    - [x] Needs to be created; see #244. Claimed by @pauladkisson.
  - Advanced tutorial: Omni vs. MASE.
    - [ ] Needs to be created; see #444. Claimed by @PerifanosPrometheus.
  - Advanced tutorial: ASE vs LSE vs N2V.
    -  [ ] Needs to be created; see #401 (needs a separate issue?)
- Inference
  - Latent Position Two-Graph Testing
  - Latent Distribution Two-Graph Testing
    - [x] Needs to be modified; see #177. Claimed by @kareef928.
- Plotting
  - Heatmap: Visualizing a Graph
  - Gridplot: Visualize Multiple Graphs
  - Pairplot: Visualizing High Dimensional Data
- Matching
  - Introduction to Graph Matching
  - Seeded Graph Matching (SGM)
- Subgraph
  - Signal Subgraph Estimators
    - [ ] Will be modified & other algorithms added; see #120, #150, #305 & #349. Claimed by @caseypw . 
- Clusterings
  - All of them
    - [x] Need to be created; see #333. Claimed by @caseypw.
- Align
  - All of them
    - [x] Need to be created; see #414. Claimed by @Jingyan230. (probably downstream from #419 )
- Currently Miscellaneous
  - Regularization, P2R.
    -  [ ] Needs to be created; see #401 (needs a separate issue?)
  - Central Limit Theorem
    -  [ ] Needs to be created; see #442 (probably downstream from #378 )
  - The Embedding, the Alignment, and The LatentDistributionTest.
    - [ ] Needs to be created; see #443 (probably downstream from Align and LDT tutorials)

issue.title: Advanced tutorial: embedding, alignment, and latent distribution test

labels.name: ndd
labels.description: tasks that may be appropriate for Neuro Data Design course

issue.body:
Tutorial should describe: 
- spectral embeddings have a non-identifiability (orthogonal transformations in the embedded space) 
- we can use the tools in the align module to circumvent this (both normal procrustes if a vertex alignment is known, or a seedless procrustes if not) 
- with these tools, latent distribution test for finite samples becomes tractable

body: @bdpedigo  I would like to take this one.

Aims for the tutorial:

1. Sign flips.
- Explain the function of the module.
- Write an example of using the module to move two datasets to the same orthant.

2. Orthogonal Procrustes
- Explain the function.
- Write an example of  using Orthogonal Procrustes for matching two datasets.

3. Seedless Procrustes
- Explain the function.
- Write an example of using Seedless Procrustes for embedding two different graphs.

@Jingyan230 
align now exists (#419), feel free to hit me up if you have any questions regarding it.
